intro: Hieracium laerbroense, commonly known as the Lübeck hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to northern Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. It features yellow flower heads that are composed of numerous small florets, and its leaves are rough to the touch with a distinctive lobed shape. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many regions.
